problems.title: Delete a Node in AVL Tree (Easy Case)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given N integers. Insert them one by one into an AVL Tree.
Then you are given one value X to delete from the AVL Tree.
This is an EASY version of AVL deletion.

In this problem, the deleted node will ALWAYS be:
1. A leaf node, OR
2. A node with only one child.

So you do NOT need to handle the two-children replacement case.
After deletion, AVL balancing may occur.
Finally, print the Preorder Traversal of the AVL Tree.

Preorder Traversal: Root → Left → Right

Input Format
The first line contains integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers.
The third line contains integer X (node to delete).

Output Format
Print preorder traversal of the AVL Tree after deletion.
If tree becomes empty, print "Tree is Empty".

Example
Input:
5
30 20 40 10 25
20

Output:
30 25 10 40

Explanation:
20 is deleted (one child case). AVL rebalances internally.
problems.examples:
Sample Input 1
5
30 20 40 10 25
20

Sample Output 1
30 25 10 40

Sample Input 2
4
10 5 15 2
2

Sample Output 2
10 5 15
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 1000
1 ≤ values ≤ 10^6
All values distinct
Deleted node will never have two children

hintsList: In this EASY version, the deleted node will NEVER have two children.
After deletion, perform AVL balancing if BF becomes ±2.
